groups.title: Peanut and Small Grain Research Unit, Stillwater, OK

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"8uhtj","text":"Â Anyone who uses the autoclave MUST sign a training log that will be kept by Angie Harting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"7scdm","text":"Personal Protective Equipment:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fen0f","text":"- DRY, arm-length autoclave gloves","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e2bav","text":"- Safety glasses","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9en7","text":"- Closed-toe shoes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b3oq4","text":"- Pants","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5dv1l","text":"- Neoprene overcoat or lab coat (optional)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"76hhr","text":"- Face shield (optional)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
protocol_references: {"blocks":[{"key":"29qc1","text":"From R. Bennett, Sterilizer (Consolidated SR-24A). Anyone who uses the autoclave MUST sign a training log that will be kept by Angie Harting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.section: Prepare Autoclave
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2unv3","text":"Sign up in advance to use the autoclave using the sign-up sheet next to the autoclave.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4uhbn","text":"Turn on using the power switch located on the right back side of the autoclave.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare Autoclave
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c16df","text":"Make sure that the chamber as well as the drain strainer is free of debris. This should be done before every cycle, every day. A clean drain strainer is essential for safe operation of the sterilizer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":76,"length":50}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Check Autoclave Settings
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cnsdc","text":"Close the door and first turn the single long handle clockwise to extend the latching arms into the door. Then turn the three-handled wheel approximately 4 times from the completely open position, using the green tape as a guide for the number of turns.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c801o","text":"Steam will exit from the door if not tightened sufficiently.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"akhld","text":"Tighten securely but not excessively; overtightening the wheel will damage the door.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":38,"length":45}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Check Autoclave Settings
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ak7bs","text":"The temperature should be set at   for most applications. If it is not at   or you need to use a different temperature, ask for assistance.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":33,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":74,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a5is6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"121","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"121","unit":10}}}}

steps.section: Check Autoclave Settings
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f62q","text":"Conserve water and energy by utilizing as much autoclave capacity whenever possible. Plan ahead and check with others about autoclaving needs before turning on the machine. However, do not compromise SAFETY.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":173,"length":36}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Check Autoclave Settings
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6iol6","text":"If sterilizing agar media, check that the âLiquidâ setting is on. This ensures that the chamber pressure will be reduced slowly to minimize boil-over of liquids. If you wish to dry your items, the âDryâ cycle may be used.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Check Autoclave Settings
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4lq7n","text":"Check that the autoclave is set for 20 minutes. This is sufficient time to sterilize most materials, so use 20 minutes unless youâre given specific instructions to use another duration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Check Autoclave Settings
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4q7lu","text":"Press âStartâ to start the cycle. Set your personal timer to ~60 minutes if you are doing a fluid cycle because it will take approximately that much time for the autoclave to return to atmospheric pressure. Set your timer 90 minutes if using a \"Dry\" cycle. It is a good idea to check back after 5-10 minutes to make sure that the autoclave door is completely shut.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Removing Items from Autoclave and Shutting Down
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"39c8l","text":"The monitor screen will indicate when the sterilization cycle is finished. You must wear closed-toe shoes. PUT ON THE PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT on the cart or hanging on the cart or the wall by the autoclave: arm-length, DRY autoclave gloves, and neoprene apron or lab coat.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":107,"length":40},{"style":"bold","offset":213,"length":65}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Removing Items from Autoclave and Shutting Down
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7uvc4","text":"Open door slowly and only partly. Stand away from the autoclave and allow a few seconds for steam to escape before opening completely. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":63}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Removing Items from Autoclave and Shutting Down
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"27e9v","text":"Carefully remove sterilized materials and place onto a cart to cool. Move the cart back to the lab and use the âHOTâ sign to warn lab mates from burning themselves.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Removing Items from Autoclave and Shutting Down
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9bukm","text":"If there are spills and debris has littered the sterilizer, allow autoclave to cool fully before cleaning. Clean it thoroughly with water, sponges, scouring pads, and paper towels before further use. Never use bleach or any other chlorides to clean the sterilizer â these are corrosive and will damage the autoclave.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":200,"length":63}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Removing Items from Autoclave and Shutting Down
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b62fb","text":"If water leaks from the front of the sterilizer, DO NOT open the door. Contact service personnel.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":97},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":97}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare Materials and Load Autoclave (Liquid and Solid)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"blh6d","text":"You MUST use secondary containment if autoclaving media with AGAR or anything else that will make a mess in the chamber (e.g. bags of soil, used media plates, potentially heat-labile plastic).","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":192}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9vh3l","text":"Secondary containment is not necessary for other items but may help in moving multiple smaller items in and out of the autoclave more easily.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dgcfh","text":"Be certain that any plastics you are sterilizing are autoclavable. If you are uncertain, use secondary containment. Do not hesitate to ask questions.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare Materials and Load Autoclave (Liquid and Solid)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4beu0","text":"Label items with autoclave tape, if you havenât already done so, to indicate that the item has been autoclaved. Adding a date on the autoclave tape can be helpful.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare Autoclave
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5i4l1","text":"Turn on the jacket pressure (top right of touch screen) to get the jacket pressure up so that the autoclave cycle will take less time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fpmid","text":"Allow autoclave ~20-30 minutes to reach jacket pressure and temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare Materials and Load Autoclave (Liquid and Solid)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1cupn","text":"Load chamber appropriately, wearing DRY orange autoclave gloves to protect your hands.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":28,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cqlba","text":"Trash must be in autoclave bags. Do NOT fill more than Â¾ full!","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ij48","text":"Appropriate secondary containers are stainless steel or aluminum trays and Nalgene bins. Choose the deeper Nalgene bins if you are autoclaving tall items, though you may need to add ~1â of roH2O to the bottom of the container to ensure even distribution of heat.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":37,"length":15},{"style":"bold","offset":56,"length":15},{"style":"bold","offset":75,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare Materials and Load Autoclave (Liquid and Solid)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d8ogj","text":"Loosen any screw caps before starting sterilization. If caps are tight, pressure may build inside the container, risking explosion or container deformation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":14},{"style":"bold","offset":121,"length":10},{"style":"bold","offset":144,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare Materials and Load Autoclave (Liquid and Solid)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ciiqp","text":"CONSIDER EASE AND SAFETY WHEN LOADING AND REMOVING ITEMS into the chamber. For example, do not load tall flasks with liquids on the top shelf where there is little space. Remove the shelf if you are sterilizing extra-tall items.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":56},{"style":"bold","offset":57,"length":112}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare Materials and Load Autoclave (Liquid and Solid)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dkhfq","text":"Liquids:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"59au9","text":"Do not sterilize liquid in the same secondary container as dry material. Liquids may boil over during the cycle and wet the dry material.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b41dc","text":"Never sterilize any volatile chemicals, pesticides, alcohols, bleach, chlorides, or any hazardous materials!","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":108}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare Materials and Load Autoclave (Liquid and Solid)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"avq9h","text":"Solids: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fme3v","text":"Biohazardous waste bags should be twist-tied to allow for air escape.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cih67","text":"The bag should be rotated to have the opening at the bottom to allow for any liquid to drain into the bins and not into the autoclave.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Sterilizer (Consolidated SR-24A)
warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"f8137","text":"Users MUST receive training, read and understand the operating manual for this piece of equipment prior to use. Personal Protective Equipment required.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":112,"length":39}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bp8bs","text":"Specific Hazards: Hot Surfaces, Hot Liquids.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
